comment: Professor Vande-Van is a solid choice for software acquisition. It's a SUPER group-heavy class, so choose your group wisely. She is not a harsh grader. Lockdown Browser + Webcam is used for her tests.

Didn't respond to my emails all semester. She gave unclear directions on the group project. Textbook not required but she would post links to wikipedia and other websites to cover the topics. I didn't like that.

Very group project based. However most her content were links to other websites and the slides have minimal at best information. Sometimes instructions arent clear but just use examples online and you should get a good grade. Know the generals of each module to pass the tests. Tests definitely are strange and random
Chill class. Specially for a 4000 level.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: Assignments are so easy so are the discussions, quizzes are a little tough but if you do the homework and discussion before you take it you will be fine. Term project was easy we received a 100 on a like eight page paper, final is very unclear on what topics to actually study so a little difficult.

My only professor that has required webcam during covid. Her online class doesn't provide much info or actual teaching. Most of the class is just clicking links and reading pages online. The assignments aren't bad. The quizzes are just T/F, but they're actually surprisingly hard. She's fine, but you'll have to work hard for an A.

I've taken her for both Operating Systems and Virtual IT Systems. She's great in person, but online classes are subpar. For online classes, there's vibe given where she's just doing the bare minimum. No slides, just assigning reading from the book and assignments from a couple years ago that have been recycled. In person, she's great at lectures.

I recommend looking for a different professor if you're trying to take this online. She has lockdown browser + webcam timed assignments that don't allow notes or book use. Has accused students of cheating. Only offers 30 minutes of tutoring. Has told several students to simply drop her course instead of attempting to actually teach.

The entire class was essentially a giant group project, with 1-2 weeks per assignment and all online quizzes/exams spread out throughout the semester. Short lectures, with most of the class (and your grade) based on the group assignments. As long as you have a good group, contribute, and do the readings, you'll be fine.

This class is oriented around group projects, so make sure you pick a good group! The class consists of about 10 modules (usually in-class assignments), 4ish exams (with one being the final), and about 14 discussion posts. As long as you participate in class, communicate with you group, and stay on top of assignments, you'll be fine.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Great Professor, just do your own work and you will be fine. Prof. Vande Ven is a great teacher. Very helpful and an advocate for the students. She also give great feedback and is always willing to help when you reach out to her.

To all that read about her giving people zeros for people who literally copy paste answers from the book and PPT slides be aware that these people don't get the definition of plagiarism which is clearly outlined in her syllabus. After the professor received numerous mass emails from outraged students she is letting them make it up. She is fair
Penalizes students for using the textbook to answer questions and displays a clear lack of understanding about the topics at hand. I could not warn someone away from this professor enough

Class was much easier than previous programming courses I have taken.  Mrs. Vande Ven is a great teacher that tries her best to keep the class engaged  even when she is getting into the meat of her lectures.  Grading is very straightforward, with weekly assignments and online quizzes, a midterm lab exam, a group project, and a final.

She makes you work hard for your grade. Make sure you get a good group project and do well on the mid-term and final because they count the majority of your grade. This was the best class I have taken and learned so much from IT Project Management.

Prof. Vande-Ven is a good instructor. She is very knowledgeable and loves to share her knowledge. Most of the programs you write are C# console apps that range from easy to intermediate difficulty. There is a MAJOR group project. She gives you practice lab exams for the final. Be sure to study your loops, sentinel values, and arrays /lists.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Taking a Vande Ven class online was pretty awful. The course itself is pretty easy, but she is disorganized. The "lectures" were not helpful, and for the last 2 units, the lectures didn't even work. The final assignment for the group project is extremely difficult. Not the worst teacher, but don't take her online.
VERY UNORGANIZED..I wish I would have read the reviews sooner.

Most assignments were console apps and fairly simple. You will have a big group project but at least its split up into 3 assignments so there is that.  The final is a 2 hour proctored lab where you have to write a program in 2 hours--however it is open book and you can use your old assignments.

Never take this class from her. She took this course for the first time and completely disorganized. 3 tests are 70% 5 discussions, 3 group labs, 3 individual labs are 30%. Tests are really tough and shell never provide answers for the tests after result. She's is rude, never agrees with you. Course deviated from subject

Very easy professor. She explained everything very clearly and relates it to real world experience. Grades very kindly. I tried very hard in her OS class and failed both tests but ended with at least a B for the class. Very understanding if you talk to her.
Very easy class.

Good teacher, the tests were a little hard. Only had two tests. The rest of the grades were your weekly labs. I hate JAVA and programming in general, and she made it easier and more understandable. Good teacher.

She is great as teacher, she understand students who wants to learn and help them to achieve their goal. Like she always says: "Programming is Fun". If you are good or bad in programming i think you should be okay with her because she do her best to make everyone love programming.
Does not provide feedback from exams timely.

Online class: Professor seems unenthusiastic about teaching course, poor teaching, extremely unclear about assignments and expectations, and delays posting grades, just to name a few. Very disappointed.

This class is one continuous PowerPoint presentation. She is somewhat unorganized and often does not do what she says she will do. She is very nice, respectful and helpful. If you want an easy class, this is it. If you want to be challenged, take someone else.

I've been programming for quite a while and was stunned at the obvious lack of real world experience with this lecturer. She's basically an IT person, which is probably why she isn't the best for programming classes. Thankfully I never had to ask questions, but the students who did were met with a puzzled about any topic outside of the assignment.

Great teacher.. wants students to participate in class discussions.  Very helpful to students.  Very little homework (pretty much all of it is reading and printing out articles ready to talk about in class), two open book tests, and a group project.  Get her if you can!
She is wonderful instructors. Books are open during the test which is very helpful. Dont wait to take her classes. Not a lot of heavy homeworks. She wants you to join the discussion.

GREAT TEACHER! Friendly, loves to teach, and is very helpful to students.  This class was C# programming... I really dont like coding, but she made it seem somewhat fun!  Always upbeat and with a smile on her face, I HIGHLY recommend her for anything!

This was a very easy class.  She teaches material straight from the book and the tests are only on what she teaches.  Only had three tests, a group paper, and an individual paper which were all easy to accomplish.  I would recommend her as a teacher for this class.

She was a pretty easy teacher.  She knew the information pretty well.  She is laid back and easy going and accepts late work if you just tell her its going to be late.  I would highly recommend her.  Only 4 fairly simple assignments, a midterm, final, and a project are all that make up the grade.  Excellent teacher.
Easy A. Make sure she knows who you are by making comments in class.

Took her for C programming.  She's knowledeable, but her class is terribly boring.  Prepare yourself for non-stop power point.  Class was easy, as far as projects and tests.  She's helpful, and pretty liberal with the grading.  Also, don't skip classes, even though you don't need to be there... she'll start giving quizzes.
Great professor.  Work load moderate.  Study for Midterm and Final.

Boring enough to make you cry, but the classes aren't particularly difficult. On top of that, she manages to cover all the important points, so she's great in my book.  She's more than willing to help and competent in her field. Perhaps my biggest complaint is that she's not quite all "together."

Easy teacher.  Her test questions could be better written, but there isnt much work.  No need to read because powerpoints come straight out of the book.  When asked about anything more advanced than what we're learning, she has trouble answering.

Goes over material fast, but it WAS a survey class.  Teaches straight out of the book, making reading redundant.  Posts PowerPoints online, making studying for exams easy.  Quizes are effort grades.  One major final project with presentation, not that difficult after finding a topic.
SHE IS A VERY HELPFUL TEACHER BUT GOES A LITTLE FAST WHEN TEACHING.  BUT DOES HAVE ALL THE NOTES ON THE INTERNET FOR YOU TO PRINT OUT IF YOU LIKE
